name: Wilson Pickett
description:
'''Wilson Pickett''' (March 18, 1941 â€“ January 19, 2006) was an American singer and songwriter.

A major figure in the development of [[soul music]], Pickett recorded more than 50 songs that made the US [[Rhythm and blues|R&B]] charts, many of which crossed over to the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]]. Among his best-known hits are "[[In the Midnight Hour]]" (which he co-wrote), "[[Land of a Thousand Dances|Land of 1000 Dances]]", "[[634-5789 (Soulsville, U.S.A.)]]", "[[Mustang Sally (song)|Mustang Sally]]", "[[Funky Broadway]]", "Engine No. 9", and "[[Don't Knock My Love]]".

Pickett was inducted into the [[Rock and Roll Hall of Fame]] in 1991, in recognition of his impact on songwriting and recording.
